New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th homer of the season, marking MLB's first 47-47 season.
Ohtani surpassed his previous career high in home runs, which was 46 in 2021.
Ohtani is three homers and two stolen bases away from achieving the first 50-50 season in MLB history.
Ohtani is one game short of the MLB record for most games with both a homer and a steal, held by Rickey Henderson.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th homer of the season against the Chicago Cubs.
Tommy Edman, Will Smith, and Max Muncy hit back-to-back-to-back homers off Chicago starter Jordan Wicks.
Ohtani swiped his 48th base of the season after working a full-count walk.
Ohtani added another single in the third inning and contributed two more RBIs.
The Dodgers eventually won the game 10-8 with help from a two-homer game by Tommy Edman.
